intro: Adenostephanus incanus, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and yellow composite flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a low-growing habit with a rosette of leaves and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Adenostephanus incanus is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
